summary: For nearly 2 decades, DOD has increased its reliance on Special Operations Forces, pushing some to the limits of their physical and mental well-being. To help special forces and their families, Special Operations Command established the Preservation of the Force and Family program in 2013. Its budget is about $80 million in FY 2021. The program offers a holistic system of care that targets physical...
title: Special Operations Forces: Additional Actions Needed to Effectively Manage the Preservation of the Force and Family Program
